intro: Polyalthia mindorensis, commonly known as Mindanao flame tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, woody fruits containing seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and parks in Southeast Asia.
